reviewText: I love this movie-it is a real feel good film that the whole family can watch together! The main character,Dani,is a spoiled 18 year old whose world is turned upside down when her father is sent to prison and she must go to live with her bachelor uncle,Sam(Kevin Sorbo). Through an orphaned colt Sam gives her to train,Dani learns that caring for others is the key to solving life's problems. Beautiful scenery and a wonderful cast which includes Dani Chuchran and Kristy Swanson as Jody,Sam's love interest,makes this film one you will want to watch over and over-I wholeheartedly recommend it!
Great movie my grandson love it
Excellent story of hidden beauty revealed, hidden strength hidden revealed, and of course villain who threatens to end it all!!

Kevin Sorbo redeemed himself ( to some extent ) in this film about a young girl who trained a special horse.  Actually, the girl was more the star in this movie.  Sorbo has a weak, lazy attitude ( as usual ) and very casually wends his way through the story.
Sorry folks, but I had to read it twice to love it twice as much. Great story; a heart warming story.
I am a big fan of Kevin Sorbo, and especially in Westerns, but this story is a pretty thin and cliched. Watch it on Hallmark before laying out the cash.

What a delightful film! The cast makes the characters live. We relate to them and share their struggles. A good story and gifted actors make the difference. Most of all, the story is about good people who we would enjoy knowing in real life. We empathize with them because of skillful character development and artful acting. This is a film the whole family can enjoy, and I recommend it highly.

Craig Clyde is my client. That said, this is just lovely. He's an exceptional writer, a rock solid director and has a very good eye in terms of spotting talent, especially in the way he casts kids (which is a skill unto itself.) Great family fare and satisfying, this man should be viewed as a talent that producers world wide would want to invest in; they won't be sorry.

This is a GREAT family movie, especially for those that love horse movies. Was thrilled to learn about having a song featured in the movie as well. Please consider checking out "Our American Song" by me and Andrea, also on Amazon, which is featured in the movie around the Hour mark (while Dani is training) : http://www.amazon.com/Our-American-Song/dp/B00FS4G42Q
It is definitely a horse lovers movie. The acting was great and the story line good. I probably will watch it again. It is worth your time.
I ordered this DVD for my husband, he hasn't had a chance to look at it yet, but I know he will be pleased with it .

I just saw this movie and it only proves, once again, that the producers / directors of these "horse" movies need a reliable consultant. At the very beginning, it showed someone wrapping a horse's leg. BACKWARDS !!!! Then it had a lovely scene at a horse show (Arabian  Regionals in Santa Barbara) that was passed off as a Thoroughbred show. Then, as the young girl was walking down a barn aisle, not only was she carrying an Arabian National garland, but it wasn't even the garland that had been presented in the horse show "clip". I know that most viewers wouldn't pick up on these irregularities, but having owned and shown Arabian horses, (at Santa Barbara and the Arabian Nationals) and been on the show circuit for 30 years, this is an insult to my intelligence. Just sayin'

This one was utterly predictable start to finish, with a cloy plot that drags and styrofoam acting.  Still, as far as family films go it was fine, and plenty of scenes with a lovable mule and various show horses make this ideal for young kids into that kind of thing.  There's a little bit of romance - very predictable and contrived of course - but no real bad content.  In fact, I don't think there was one swear word, no major violence (there's a plane crash later in the film but with only minor injuries - you know, the little bit of blood by the side of the mouth kind of thing) and no adult content, so this is an ideal pizza-night family film if you're into that kind of thing.  If you're a film theory major, hit the Kurosawa section instead and skip this one.
The story was wonderful, Acting absolutly Great,  I would recommend this movie to my friends and family.  Very Good and I watch it very often.

I loved this movie...It was pretty funny seeing Kevin Sorbo and his Wife, Sam disliking each other on screen! The story was inspiring and uplifting and i'd recommend this movie to anyone who wants to watch a good family movie.

This well done, superbly acted movie is one you'll want to watch as a family. It is touching from the git go and never sappy like some family films can be. I like the positive attitudes of the two young people. Despite very trying circumstances they both remained sweet natured, caring about others and polite. Kevin Sorbo is a really good actor. The lady who played his girlfriend was also a winner. The younger child's Mon did a great job of playing a nasty women. I highly recommend this movie.
I chose this movie because we know Kevin Sorbo (and his wife Sam, who is also in the movie) and they make good, clean movies that the whole family can watch.
A good made for TV movie. It was a little predictable. I like seeing Kevin Sorbo in other roles besides Hercules.

This is hands down the cutest family movie out there. I didn't think it'd be much, but it's actually a very good lesson movie for children. No bad language, good values, HORSES and an adorable MULE, KEVIN SORBO... ok I love it.

A cute movie, and good to watch, but I was surprised by its 5 Star rating. It does have a five star message, but the acting on all accounts was pretty lame, except for the dog ~ the dog was the best one! I would recommend this for 10 to 13 year old kids because it is a cute story, and the message of love and adjusting to difficult circumstances  was a powerful one that would be great for this age group to see.
I liked this movie because it was good and wholesome. The only reason I didn't rate it five stars, excellent, was because there were some unrealistic parts.

Storm Rider is a really good family movie. my husband, granddaughter and I watched it and we all enjoyed it and came away with a really good feeling. Great ending!

This is a very good all around movie. Not corny and not real heavy type of movie. It was very enjoyable, no bad language, another one about life's lessons. I gave it a 4 star simply because it is not a great movie, I reserve 5 star for movies like Man from Snowy River and this movie is not in that class.
It is a great family movie with the underlying message of material things mean less than goodness from the heart.
I Really liked this movie! I like Kevin Sorbo & this movie has His wife Sam in it as well! It is a simply story about truth & Comsequences! It also shows "love & Kindness"!

EXCELLENT FAMILY MOVIE! No Bad Language! Imparts life lesson that even young people understand. Spoiled rich girl's father goes to prison and she has to go live with her bachelor country vet uncle.  You don't have to be a horse lover or Kevin Sorbo fan to enjoy this film, but if you are, you will definitely love this film! Both Kevin and Kristy Swanson are very good, (Kevin is actually quite funny).  Wish there were more films like it! Good Job!
This is one of the best horse movies I have enjoyed in a long time!! definitely recommended for anyone !

Great, entertaining movie with an uplifting message. Kevin Sorbo and Kristy Swanson are excellent, and it's interesting to note that the female lead, Dani Cucheran, is a champion equestrian in real life. Then, the little brother is so adorable....extra sympathy for putting up with an uncaring mother.
great story. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS DVD TO ANYONE WHO WANTS GOOD ENTERTAINMENT.... THIS IS ALL I HAVE TO SAY ON THE SUBJECT

We enjoyed this clean movie very much.  The only reason it did not receive 5 stars was that the sound mix was unbalanced. The background music was too loud, and we could not hear the voices without turning the volume up - then the music was too loud.

This is a good family movie, and they are hard to come by these days. Bad things happen but this movie shows the importance of not giving up, that perseverance through trials and hard times will eventually lead you into a better situation, occupation, relationship etc. if you can develop an open mind. I found this movie to be entertaining and uplifting too.

Storm Rider is a family movie that has a few twists. The movie does an excellent job portraying more family conflicts and complexities than we see in the typical family movies.

The screenplay and writing are good. Kristy Swanson has a challenging role as Jody Peterson who seems too good to be true, and she does a wonderful job making this character believable. Another standout is Danielle Chuchran who plays Dani Fielding, the difficult teenage female!!!!!!
A very good movie.
Love this movie! Kevin Sorbo is another down to earth actor. This is a great story.
